title: The Ultimate Book of Decorative Knots (gnv64)
description:
The Ultimate Book of Decorative Knots 
by Lindsey Philpott
Skyhorse Publishing | 2012 | ISBN: 1408157268 | 400 pages | PDF | 102 mb

All knots are useful, but many can also be very beautiful. Here, Lindsey Philpott, expert knot tyer, sets out to provide the most comprehensive, useful, and attractive book of decorative knots from around the world. Readers will learn the materials, methods, measurements, and tools needed to tie dozens of beautiful knots. Flat knots, round knots, square knots, covering knotsÃ¢â‚¬â€you name it, and this book has it. From braids to plaits to sinnets, here are step-by-step instructions accompanied by full-color photographs for the knot tyerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s reference. Chapters include:
-    Getting Started
-    Purely Decorative Knots
-    Netting and Woven Knots
-    TurkÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Head Knots
-    Knob Knots
-    And much more!
Philpott provides a brief history of knotting, in addition to instructions and helpful images. Practical tips, like what materials not to use will advise beginners about the details of knot tying. Once you practice the knots illustrated in these pages, you can use the information to create your own individual styleÃ¢â‚¬â€and even some new knots! Handy reference book as well as a beautiful gift, this is an essential addition to every knot enthusiastÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s library. 1,600 color illustrations

About the Author <a href="
http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/ciu/30/52/438e6d917fc20ad8986c7f.L._V192267139_.jpg" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/ciu/30/52/438e6d917fc20ad8986c7f.L._V192267139_.jpg</a>
Lindsey Philpott (1948 - ) was born in England, where he lived for thirty-three years, soaking up the English sunshine at every opportunity, growing vegetables and fruit in his Plympton home. He has a wife, Kim, and four children, David, Elizabeth, Nicholas and Benjamin - ask him about them! He has spent many years learning knotting, from the age of six onwards, and is now sharing some of that learned and acquired knowledge with all. His greatest thrill is to show young people how they can tie knots - he teaches knotting at the drop of a line or the merest note of a puzzle involving cords. He now edits the international magazine "Knotting Matters" for the International Guild of Knot Tyers, of which organization he has been a member since 1997. More is yet to come, so keep a weather eye open for the next installment in his career, his writing and his life. Lindsey Philpott is the president of the Pacific Americas Branch of the International Guild of Knot Tyers. He has provided forensic knot analyses in criminal cases and teaches rigging and rope work.
